newsitem.title: UK: A&L leads financials up on new Halifax price.
newsitem.headline: A&L leads financials up on new Halifax price.

text.p: Shares in Alliance & Leicester Plc rose in brisk trade as grey market prices for Halifax shares rose to 700p on Friday, dragging other financial stocks up, analysts said.

A&L shares put on 17p to 616p with nearly two million traded and Barclays Plc rose 23-1/2p to 1,232p with more than 1.5 million changing hands. National Westminster Bank Plc rose 11-1/2p to 795p and Lloyds Bank Plc 5p to 618-1/2p.
City bookmakers, City Index and IG Index, quoted the Halifax closing price on June 2, its flotation day, at 695/705p.
"The stocks have drifted off on profit-taking this week and so this is a nice, sensible excuse for a little buying," said one analyst.
"Let's reserve judgement on whether it's a sensible price though," she said.
On Wednesday analysts at Dresdner Kleinwort Benson put an estimate of 660p on shares in the demutualising building society, market sources said. -- Louise Ireland, London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
